instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1708: What is A1708? A1708 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2017, 2016 with EMC 3164, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00840, 820-00875..
definitions.820-00840: What is 820-00840? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V3_G3H: What is PP3V3_G3H? PP3V3_G3H is a 3.3v power line that is present when the machine is in a Global System Hardware Off state, and should come on before most other rails so that the USB-C circuitry can be powered for the charger.
definitions.PP1V8_UPC_XB_LDOD: What is PP1V8_UPC_XB_LDOD? PP3V3_UPC_XB_LDO is an LDO coming out of the CD3215 USB-C muxing chip. When this is missing, either a capacitor on the line has shorted, PP3V3_G3H is missing, or the CD3215 is bad..
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.CHGR_BMON: What is CHGR_BMON? CHGR_BMON goes between the ISL6259, ISL9239, or ISL9240 that charges the battery & creates PPBUS_G3H and the SMC(system management controller) or T2 chip(on machines where the SMC is integrated into the T2 chip) and provides current sensing information on battery charging to the SMC. If diagnostics reveal an off reading or failure with the charger current sense, this is a good place to start troubleshooting..
definitions.PPVIN_G3H_P3V3G3H: What is PPVIN_G3H_P3V3G3H? This is the input from the USB-C charger or the battery that is the input voltage for the chip responsible for creating PP3V3_G3H. It can be missing when capacitors on this line are shorted to ground, or when the diode in front of it leading to the chip that creates PP3V3_G3H is blown. .
definitions.CHGR_AMON: What is CHGR_AMON? CHGR_AMON provides DC current sense information to the SMC(System management controller) or T2 chip(on machines where the SMC is integrated into the T2 chip). It comes from the battery charging chip that controls the laptop charger, battery charging, and creation of PPBUS_G3H(ISL6259, ISL9239, or ISL9240 chip depending on the logic board part number and model). This is used for sensors. If a DC current sense sensor is reading off in diagnostics, this is a place to start looking. .
definitions.3V3_S5: What is 3V3_S5? 3V3_S5 and PP3V3_S5 are interchangeable, see definition for PP3V3_S5. .
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.SMC_ONOFF_L: What is SMC_ONOFF_L? SMC_ONOFF_L tells the computer that the power button has been pressed when it is low, _L means signal is asserted when it is low voltage. .
definitions.PM_SLP_S4_L: What is PM_SLP_S4_L? PM_SLP_S4_L is a signal that puts the system into an S4 suspend to disk sleep state when it is low(_L means signal is asserted when voltage is low).

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A not asking for 20v (LR343)
threads.message:
Motherboard looks fine but only asking for 5v on both usb-c.

<CHIP>U3100</CHIP> Pin 2 <SIGNAL>PP1V8_UPC_XA_LDOD</SIGNAL> = 1.8v, 0.46,, Pin 12 PP3v3_UPC_XA__LDO = 3.39v, 0.486,, Pin 35 <SIGNAL>PP1V1_UPC_XA_LDO</SIGNAL> = 1.1v, 0.467,, Pin 75 <SIGNAL>PP1V8_UPC_XA_LDO</SIGNAL> = 1.79v, 0.49.

<CHIP>U3200</CHIP> Pin 2 <SIGNAL>PP1V8_UPC_XB_LDOD</SIGNAL> = 1.79v, 0.457,, Pin 12 PP3v3_UPC_XB__LDO = 3.37v, 0.486,, Pin 35 <SIGNAL>PP1V1_UPC_XB_LDO</SIGNAL> = 1.1v, 0.458,, Pin 75 <SIGNAL>PP1V8_UPC_XB_LDO</SIGNAL> = 1.8v, 0.487.

<SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> = 3.41v, 0.339.

<SIGNAL>DIV_PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> = 0v, OL.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A not asking for 20v (LR343)
threads.message:
Any history available?

Do you get OL in diode mode at F7000?
Be sure to check it correctly.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A not asking for 20v (LR343)
threads.message:
The customer says that one day it was working and the next not. So far I cannot see any signs of corrosion on any component. The keyboard keys in the bottom right show signs that there may have been a spillage at some point. They are not springing back up as fast as the other keys, but it is only a minor difference. I have found no liquid. The fan is under this part of the keyboard. I have extracted the fan and see no damage.

I get 0.417 on diode mode at F7000.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A not asking for 20v (LR343)
threads.message: If <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is not present, post basic voltages for <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>; <SIGNAL>P_IN</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>AUX_DET</SIGNAL>, VDDA/P, <SIGNAL>SMC_RST</SIGNAL>*, <SIGNAL>AUX_OK</SIGNAL>, A/BMON.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A not asking for 20v (LR343)
threads.message:
No, apologies. That was <SIGNAL>DIV_PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>.

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is giving 13.04v and 0.400

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A not asking for 20v (LR343)
threads.message:
No reason to check them, if <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> has correct voltage.

Do you get <SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL>?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A not asking for 20v (LR343)
threads.message:
Yes.

<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> gives 3.32v

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A not asking for 20v (LR343)
threads.message: Trigger <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> and check for drop pulse at <SIGNAL>PCH_PWRBTN_L</SIGNAL> (at same time).

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A not asking for 20v (LR343)
threads.message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 85886, member: 682"]
Trigger <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> and check for drop pulse at <SIGNAL>PCH_PWRBTN_L</SIGNAL> (at same time).
[/QUOTE]

Could you explain this procedure in more detail, please.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A not asking for 20v (LR343)
threads.message: [URL unfurl="true"]https://boards.rossmanngroup.com/threads/how-to-collection.60974/[/URL]

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A not asking for 20v (LR343)
threads.message:
When I trigger <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> to ground there is no change at <SIGNAL>PCH_PWRBTN_L</SIGNAL>. 

Stays at 3.3v

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A not asking for 20v (LR343)
threads.message:
Did you check it at same time when trigger <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL>?
If no reaction, the problem should be on SMC, or PMIC areas.

Do you get 13V at <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>, but still 5V on both USB-C inputs?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A not asking for 20v (LR343)
threads.message:
Yes, at the same time.

Correct. 5v on both usbc and 13v on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A not asking for 20v (LR343)
threads.message:
I checked again and <SIGNAL>PCH_PWRBTN_L</SIGNAL> is dropping to 0.34v

I don't understand why that didn't happen the first time. I was doing it simultaneously.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A not asking for 20v (LR343)
threads.message:
If <SIGNAL>PCH_PWRBTN_L</SIGNAL> reacts, means SMC sends the signal to PCH.
Now check for pulse at <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL>, at same time.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A not asking for 20v (LR343)
threads.message:
I plugged in the power this morning and it's getting 20v
I didn't change anything.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A not asking for 20v (LR343)
threads.message: I connected the drive and it booted, but showed signs of gfx failure.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A not asking for 20v (LR343)
threads.message:
Can be CPU, or RAM issue.
Boot menu is showed correctly?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A not asking for 20v (LR343)
threads.message: Yes. Displayed correctly until after i put password in and it was loading into the operating system. When it got to the desktop it looked better but not perfect. It ran sluggishly for an hour before I powered it off.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A not asking for 20v (LR343)
threads.message:
Possibly iGPU problem.
Test first with new macOS installation.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A not asking for 20v (LR343)
threads.message: But I didn't do anything to repair the original problem. It just fixed itself. I don't expect that to last.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A not asking for 20v (LR343)
threads.message:
It endlessly loads Catalina. Usb C key connected directly.
That is without the SSD attached.

With the SSD it still loads into the OS but appears purple sometimes. Still sluggish.

threads.message: Board still extracted. Only connected to external monitor.
